txt.en: 'I must ask one other favour of you, [placeholder]. The lovely lady I saw you with...Noriel was her name, was it not? I find that I cannot seem to stop thinking about her.\n\n'I saw lovely flowers growing throughout this forest, but I dare not wander out to pick them for fear of angering Noriel further with our presence. Perhaps you would be so good as to pick me some flowers...for I wish to have some as a keepsake, to remember her loveliness by.'

'They are lovely indeed, [placeholder]. They are nothing to her beauty, but they will serve as a reminder, at the very least.'

Wynmar gazes at the flowers, then starts, as if struck by a sudden notion.

'I have thought of an even better use for these flowers, [placeholder]. I know how they could become much more dear to me. I would make them a gift to Noriel herself.'
Wynmar has asked you to gather flowers to remind him of the beauty of Noriel, which he does not wish to ever forget.
Gold-and-white flowers grow throughout the northern parts of Thinglad.\n\nYou should collect flowers for Wynmar to have as a keepsake, to remind him of fair Noriel.
Wynmar is at his camp in Thinglad, soon to depart.\n\nYou should bring the lovely flowers you gathered to Wynmar before he leaves Thinglad for good.
